00022 /// @file   MidasSpliceDetector.cpp
00023 /// @brief  Microarray detection of alternative splicing methods.

00040 /**
00041  *  \brief Constructor.
00042  *
00043  *  Translates group ids into offsets into list of unique ids,
00044  *  builds full, reduced design matrices.
00045  *
00046  *  @param groups Vector of experimental group ids.
00047  *  @param wantPvalues Caller requests p values.
00048  *  @param wantFstats Caller requests F statistics.
00049  *  @param wantNormalized Caller requests normalized exon signal.
00050  *  @param logStabilize Amount to add to data before taking logarithm.
00051  *  @param noLogTransform Do not log transform data.
00052  *
00053  *  Errors: call errAbort if all requested output flags are false.
00054 */
00055 midasSpliceDetector::midasSpliceDetector (const std::vector<int>& groups, int wantPvalues,
00056       int wantFstats, int wantNormalized, const float& logStabilize, int noLogTransform)
00057     : groups (groups), wantPvalues (wantPvalues), wantFstats (wantFstats),
00058       wantNormalized (wantNormalized), logStabilize (logStabilize),
00059       noLogTransform (noLogTransform), N (groups.size())
00060 {
00061   // if the caller doesn't want any output, (s)he shouldn't bother calling
00062   if (! (wantPvalues || wantFstats || wantNormalized))
00063     Err::errAbort("midasSpliceDetector: at least one output is required");
00064 
00065   sampleSetup ();
00066   buildDesignMatrix ();
00067   buildSampleOnlyDesignMatrix ();
00068 }

00070 // Debug -- print the input values for comparison to the original
00071 void
00072 dump_vector(std::string vec_label,const std::vector<float>& vec)
00073 {
00074   int vec_size;
00075   vec_size=vec.size();
00076   printf("%s[%d]==",vec_label.c_str(),vec_size);
00077   for (int i=0;i<vec_size;i++) {
00078     printf("%f, ",vec[i]);
00079   }
00080   printf("\n");
00081 }

00084 /**
00085  *  \brief Process single exon, gene data.
00086  *
00087  *  Matlab: Do a 1-way ANOVA testing for no sample effects.
00088  *  model tests:
00089  *  log (exon signal) - log (gene signal) = constant
00090  *  against
00091  *  log (exon signal) - log (gene signal) = constant + sample effect
00092  *
00093  *  Output:
00094  *  (1) fstat: for this nexon, the F-statistic on dfModel (reduced design)
00095  *  numerator degrees of freedom and df1 (full design) denominator degrees of freedom.
00096  *  (2) normalizedSignal: a vector of nscans normalized exon signal.
00097  *  Each vector is relative to the nexon, max is 0.
00098  *  Within groups the values are the same.
00099  *  (3) pvalue: p-value corresponding to the f statistic.
00100  *  The output normalizedSignal vector is preallocated by the caller.
00101  *
00102  *  Errors: call errAbort if the exon and gene data vectors are not both
00103  *  equal in size to the count N of group ids (scans).
00104  *  If normalizedSignal output is requested, call errAbort if the normalizedSignal
00105  *  vector is not equal in size to the count N of group ids.
00106  *
00107  *  @param exonData Exon data.
00108  *  @param geneData Gene data.
00109  *  @return fstat F statistic.
00110  *  @return normalizedSignal Vector of normalized exon signals.
00111  *  @return pvalue P value.
00112 */
00113 void midasSpliceDetector::runMidasSingle (const std::vector<float>& exonData,
00114                                           const std::vector<float>& geneData,
00115                                           float* fstat,
00116                                           std::vector<float>* normalizedSignal,
00117                                           float* pvalue)
00118 {
00119   // Debug -- print the input values for comparison to the original
00120   //printf("--------------------\n");
00121   //dump_vector("exonData",exonData);
00122   //dump_vector("geneData",geneData);
00123 
00124   // validate vector sizes
00125   if (! ( exonData.size() == N && geneData.size() == N && (!wantNormalized || normalizedSignal->size() == N) ))
00126     Err::errAbort("midasSpliceDetector: invalid vector sizes");
00127 
00128   // Matlab: use exon level estimates
00129   ColumnVector fittedData;
00130   double residSsq;
00131   double m1Ssq;
00132   getEffects (fullDesign, exonData, geneData, fittedData, residSsq, m1Ssq);
00133 
00134   double m2Ssq;
00135   double modelSsq;
00136   getEffects (reducedDesign, exonData, geneData, fittedData, m2Ssq, modelSsq);
00137 
00138   // residSsq will be zero if the exonData and geneData vectors are identical
00139   double myFstat = 0.0;
00140   if (residSsq != 0.0)
00141     myFstat = modelSsq/residSsq;
00142 
00143   if (wantFstats)
00144     *fstat = (float) myFstat;
00145 
00146   if (wantNormalized)
00147   {
00148     const double maxFitted = fittedData.Maximum();
00149     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < N; ++i)
00150       (*normalizedSignal)[i] = (float) (fittedData (i+1) - maxFitted);
00151   }
00152 
00153   // convert the F statistic to a p value via the cumulative F distribution function
00154   if (wantPvalues)
00155     *pvalue = (float) affxstat::Ftest (myFstat, dfModel, df1);
00156 }
00157 
00158 /**
00159  *  \brief Process multiple exons, single gene data.
00160  *
00161  *  Invokes the single exon, gene data runMidas for each
00162  *  exon in the input vector of vectors.
00163  *  Produce vector of fstat and pvalue results, vector
00164  *  of vector of normalizedSignal results.
00165  *
00166  *  Errors: call errAbort if the respective output requested flag
00167  *  is set, and the fstat, normalizedSignal, and pvalue
00168  *  vectors are not each equal in size to that of the exon vector.
00169  *
00170  *  @param exonData Exon data as a vector of vectors.
00171  *  @param geneData Gene data as a vector.
00172  *  @return fstat F statistics as a vector.
00173  *  @return normalizedSignal(s) as a vector of vectors.
00174  *  @return pvalue P values as a vector.
00175 */
00176 void midasSpliceDetector::runMidasMultiple (const std::vector<std::vector<float> >& exonData,
00177                                             const std::vector<float>& geneData,
00178                                             std::vector<float>* fstat,
00179                                             std::vector<std::vector<float> >* normalizedSignal,
00180                                             std::vector<float>* pvalue)
00181 {
00182   const unsigned int dataSize = exonData.size();
00183   if (! ( (!wantFstats || fstat->size() == dataSize) && (!wantNormalized || normalizedSignal->size() == dataSize)
00184       && (!wantPvalues || pvalue->size() == dataSize) ))
00185     Err::errAbort("midasSpliceDetector: invalid vector sizes");
00186 
00187   // allow caller to pass a null pointer in the case of unwanted output
00188   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < dataSize; ++i)
00189   {
00190     float* pFstat = fstat ? &(*fstat)[i] : 0;
00191     vector<float>* pNormalizedSignal = normalizedSignal ? &(*normalizedSignal)[i] : 0;
00192     float* pPvalue = pvalue ? &(*pvalue)[i] : 0;
00193     runMidasSingle (exonData[i], geneData, pFstat, pNormalizedSignal, pPvalue);
00194   }
00195 }

00197 /**
00198  *  \brief Set up sample (group) offsets into unique list of ids.
00199  *
00200  *  Matlab: groupIdentifiers is a vector of integers identifying samples.
00201  *  Biological samples belonging to the same group have the same integer value.
00202 
00203  *  Output: vector containing offset of sample ids in unique sample id list, count of unique sample ids.
00204  *  Errors: none except allocation - if passed an empty vector, produce an empty vector, zero count.
00205 */
00206 void midasSpliceDetector::sampleSetup ()
00207 {
00208   sample_offsets = vector<int> (N);
00209   vector<int> s_sorted (groups);
00210   sort (s_sorted.begin(), s_sorted.end());      // sort to identify unique ids
00211 
00212   vector<int> unique_samples;   // unique ids
00213   unique_copy (s_sorted.begin(), s_sorted.end(), back_inserter(unique_samples));
00214   T = unique_samples.size();
00215 
00216   // see 'Effective STL' 'Distinguish among count, find, binary_search, lower_bound,
00217   // upper_bound, and equal_range' for a good discussion on searching containers
00218   typedef vector<int>::iterator VIIter_t;
00219   const VIIter_t unique_begin = unique_samples.begin();
00220   const VIIter_t unique_end = unique_samples.end();
00221   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < N; ++i)
00222     sample_offsets[i] = distance (unique_begin, lower_bound (unique_begin, unique_end, groups[i]));
00223 }
00224 
00225 /**
00226  *  \brief Generate full design matrix.
00227  *
00228  *  The full design matrix assumes no alternative splicing.
00229  *  Matlab: Construct the design matrix for M probe effects (for a single exon).
00230  *      Given N samples with T unique samples, so T sample effects
00231  *      and all interactions of probes within probeset by tissue.
00232  *      Samples are an array of integer replicate ids.
00233  *  Input: vector of sample ids translated into offset into unique id list, count N of samples,
00234  *         count T of unique ids.
00235  *  Output: full matrix describing the experimental design.
00236  *  Note: in the midasSpliceDetector Matlab script, the count M of probe effects = ndataPerPS
00237  *  is hard-coded to 1 - this simplification is reflected here in the buildDesignMatrix()
00238  *  and buildSampleOnlyDesignMatrix() methods.
00239  *  Comment on probe effects count: use an exon-level estimate from Plier not 4 from probe data.
00240 */
00241 void midasSpliceDetector::buildDesignMatrix ()
00242 {
00243   // Matlab: design matrix is of full rank since including all effects
00244   fullDesign = Matrix (N, T);
00245   fullDesign = 0.0;
00246 
00247   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < N; ++i)
00248     // Matlab: each interaction matrix for the probe effects x i-th sample effect
00249     fullDesign (i + 1, (sample_offsets[i] + 1)) = 1.0;
00250   df1 = fullDesign.Ncols();
00251 }
00252 
00253 /**
00254  *  \brief Generate reduced design matrix.
00255  *
00256  *  The reduced design matrix allows for alternative splicing.
00257  *  Matlab: Given N samples with T unique samples and M probes,
00258  *      construct the design matrix for T sample effects (for a single exon).
00259  *      Samples are an array of integer replicate ids.
00260  *  Input: vector of sample ids translated into offset into unique id list, count N of samples,
00261  *         count T of unique ids.
00262  *  Output: Reduced matrix describing the experimental design.
00263  *  Note: as in buildDesignMatrix(), the count M of probe effects is assumed to be 1.
00264 */
00265 void midasSpliceDetector::buildSampleOnlyDesignMatrix ()
00266 {
00267   // Matlab: design matrix is of rank (T-1) for sample effects only
00268   Matrix sampleEffect (N, T);
00269   sampleEffect = 0.0;
00270 
00271   // Matlab: i-th sample effect
00272   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < N; ++i)
00273     // column is the offset of the sample id in the vector of unique ids
00274     sampleEffect (i + 1, sample_offsets[i] + 1) = 1.0;
00275 
00276   // Matlab: project onto a subspace orthogonal to the mean and
00277   // probe effect subspace given the design matrix A for mean and probe effects
00278   // A = repmat(eye(M), N, 1); design matrix for mean and probe effects
00279   // B = nulbasis(A); column basis for orthogonal subspace to A
00280   // P = B*inv(B'*B)*B'is the projection matrix
00281   // C = colbasis(sampleEffect); C is the column basis of sampleEffect
00282   // P*C will be the column basis of sampleEffect projected onto B
00283   // nulbasis relies on Matlab's rref() row-reduced echelon form
00284   // function; prefer not to implement that, just generate the matrix B
00285   // eliminate call C = colbasis(sampleEffect) - for a full rank sampleEffect,
00286   // the case here, colbasis(sampleEffect) equals sampleEffect.
00287   Matrix B (N, (N - 1));
00288   for (unsigned int i = 1; i <= N - 1; ++i)     // newmat indices range from 1 to N (here N - 1)
00289     B (1, i) = -1.0;    // top row all elements -1.0
00290   IdentityMatrix eyeB (N - 1);
00291   B.SubMatrix (2, N, 1, (N - 1)) = eyeB;        // the rest of B
00292 
00293   // Matlab: recommended the Matlab way to do this P*C = B*(B\C)
00294   // i.e. solving Bx = C
00295   // design = colbasis(B*(B\C));
00296   // QRZ destroys the input matrices - copy B for later use
00297   Matrix X = B;
00298   UpperTriangularMatrix U (N - 1);
00299   Matrix M (N - 1, T);
00300   QRZ (X, U);
00301   QRZ (X, sampleEffect, M);
00302   Matrix temp = B * U.i() * M;  // design = B*(B\sampleEffect)
00303 
00304   reducedDesign = temp.SubMatrix (1, N, 1, (T - 1));    // what colbasis() does
00305   dfModel = reducedDesign.Ncols();
00306 }
00307 
00308 /**
00309  *  \brief Find effects for given design matrix, data.
00310  *
00311  *  Input: design matrix, vectors of probe and gene data.
00312  *  Output: fitted data vector (for normalized signal), residual
00313  *  and model sums of squares, model degrees of freedom.
00314  *
00315  *  If so requested by the user, do not log transform the data.
00316  *
00317  *  Errors: call errAbort if arguments for log() are negative.
00318  *  Assume that the vectors are of the appropriate size
00319  *  (checked in runMidas()).
00320  *
00321  *  @param design Design matrix.
00322  *  @param adjExonData Exon data.
00323  *  @param geneData Gene data.
00324  *  @return fittedData Column vector containing fitted data.
00325  *  @return residSsq Residual sum of squares.
00326  *  @return modelSsq Model sum of squares.
00327 */
00328 void midasSpliceDetector::getEffects (const Matrix& design,
00329                                       const std::vector<float>& exonData,
00330                                       const std::vector<float>& geneData,
00331                                       ColumnVector& fittedData,
00332                                       double& residSsq,
00333                                       double& modelSsq)
00334 {
00335   ColumnVector residuals (N);   // residuals are returned here
00336   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < N; ++i)
00337   {
00338     if (noLogTransform)
00339       residuals (i+1) = exonData[i] - geneData[i];
00340     else
00341     {
00342         if ((exonData[i] + logStabilize) <= 0 || (geneData[i] + logStabilize) <= 0)
00343             Err::errAbort("Attempt to take the logarithm of a non-positive number");
00344 
00345         // Matlab: log is actually log + small ... logStabilize (default 8)
00346         residuals (i+1) = log (exonData[i] + logStabilize) - log (geneData[i] + logStabilize);
00347     }
00348   }
00349 
00350   // fit = design\(pData-gData);
00351   Matrix X = design;    // QRZ destroys input matrices
00352   const int dfModel = design.Ncols();
00353   UpperTriangularMatrix U (dfModel);
00354   Matrix M (dfModel, 1);
00355   QRZ (X, U);
00356   QRZ (X, residuals, M);
00357   Matrix fit = U.i() * M;
00358 
00359   // fittedData=design*fit;
00360   fittedData = design * fit;
00361   // residuals = pData - gData - fittedData;
00362   // residuals have already been calculated by QRZ
00363 
00364   // dfModel = rank(design);
00365   // dfFull = (length(gData) - dfModel);
00366   // residSsq = residuals' * residuals/dfFull;
00367   Matrix Ssq = (residuals.t() * residuals) / (N - dfModel);
00368   residSsq = Ssq (1,1); // can't directly read product into a double
00369 
00370   // modelSsq = fittedData'*fittedData/dfModel;
00371   Ssq = (fittedData.t() * fittedData) / dfModel;
00372   modelSsq = Ssq (1,1);
00373 }
